node.title: Pell Grant
node.body:
fixes #398 
<!--
copilot:all
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at fee964b</samp>

### Summary
🎓📊🧪

<!--
1.  🎓 - This emoji represents the Pell Grant program, which is a form of financial aid for college students.
2.  📊 - This emoji represents the parameters and formulas that are used to calculate the EFC and the Pell Grant amount, which are based on data and statistics.
3.  🧪 - This emoji represents the tests that are added to verify the accuracy and functionality of the new variables and parameters.
-->
This pull request adds and updates several parameters and tests for the Pell Grant program and the Emergency Broadband Benefit. It also fixes a bug in the categorical eligibility parameter for the Affordable Connectivity Program. The changes aim to improve the accuracy and completeness of the policy engine for these programs.

> _We are the masters of the `pell_grant` formula_
> _We know the secrets of the `EFC` and the `head_contribution`_
> _We test our code with precision and rigor_
> _We are the rebels of the `categorical_eligibility` parameter_

### Walkthrough
*  Add new parameter files for the EFC calculation for the Pell Grant program, based on the official EFC formula guide for 2022-2023 ([link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3b3bc2777ea4d43a22c8e858a7e5896b8db1fbb354f5279167d4d499025bf2faR1-R9), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-22daea8386d23f1cfa7cfbdf94e7699720d8df3707cd191880fc5f5db3550ba0R1-R9), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-17e0763f964cff6c4cc6262f46deaf5253c1d75dd758fc6c6b4963d0d41d64bdR1-R9), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-1e43c7909315d3321ef713ddb7eff25bb85efbe1376ff2c27d018c797ab8d142R1-R9), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-03a2eb3157ea37c0dc74a5de014655f3fb5c12cbcaa018972aec513be3b8de3bR1-R13), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-ac572a2e068c459cb38767068a6eb16a1608c9697e1c1e2feb44ceeafe7bc0f3R1-R38), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-74d61351919e18a19d8947a2ae93d6cfec38ea123394e5a39980126977f60492R1-R13), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-59ab78638fd83d390a785b070bb3ed02d727d642764d4905cbc5b63f0b847f20R1-R38), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-c747947afd2100f230f0d3df12639e95878c208c0907f4358c21eb0fe40191d2R1-R34))
*  Add new parameter files for the maximum and minimum values of the Pell Grant, based on the official Pell Grant payment and disbursement schedules for 2023-2024 ([link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-927d97633d8404036a680c10830c256554ad192b4070d50af0914be7b809e247R1-R9), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-4541e68af13b4f2c4b0974bd442714230d44d2da00843909e9f3299d41f4ff3aR1-R9))
*  Add new parameter file for the months in school year for the Pell Grant, based on the official EFC formula guide for 2022-2023 ([link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-c1d14ae400a9dc1ac9c84aac021787458c193f5d4bf454a368bc6d2564e6ad83R1-R9))
*  Modify the categorical eligibility parameter for the Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) and the Emergency Broadband Benefit (EBB) to use the new variable `spm_unit_pell_grant` instead of `pell_grant`, to align with the statutory language of 47 USC 1752(a)(6)(C) ([link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-2551980cdd56065ef551909a802db221a877dd6c6c0ebde9b12cd8ddcdd2f3c9L9-R9), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-c1a73ef638bb27729743c83908a2ac09ab76d5b710661d6527c3a0e06d920c54L10-R10))
*  Modify the quotation marks around the reference names and hrefs for the categorical eligibility parameter for the ACP to use single quotes instead of double quotes, to follow the YAML convention ([link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-2551980cdd56065ef551909a802db221a877dd6c6c0ebde9b12cd8ddcdd2f3c9L15-R18))
*  Add new test files for the `pell_grant_dependent_allowances`, `pell_grant_dependent_contribution`, `pell_grant_efc`, `pell_grant_head_available_income`, `pell_grant_head_contribution`, and `pell_grant` variables, with different test cases for each variable ([link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-c19522563282c6b112124b25f5feb714e6e4893b2c7af1c7f947da2bff68aec9R1-R23), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-49d94f21e00244017f4496dcbecf5e53d16e6b0c21911e7e6310eba73dfbf406R1-R35), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-178749dd9a7bf8ea1c83924e6a895f784b8c9986fb17eb1536aa2e11c4f49b64R1-R79), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-90320415157a7a867ef58ea1ad4fc7a93736690051371db0900a1ca5cf9af873R1-R69), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-80cb1c4bf3e85b750794ddbdd1272b6920cc9815f4a8543fda72c7cfd5049606R1-R53), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/2764/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-0daf0574b14818c9fc810994f11c5877e79a441d1de624a423a9dd81dd7ac166R1-R26))

☔ View full report in Codecov by Sentry.
📢 Have feedback on the report? Share it here.
Could you also add some integration tests based on externally available Pell Grant calculators? Or we can merge it in so we can try it in our own web app first if you prefer.

node.bodyText: Great stuff Caleb! Did you want to make this PR a full implementation or save some parts for other PRs? For example it looks like we could fill in some other formulas to tie it together with the rest of the package. Otherwise mostly nits here.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              rate_unit: /1
          
          
            
              amount_unit: /1

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              threshold_unit: /1
          
          
            
              threshold_unit: currency-USD

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              unit: curency-USD
          
          
            
              unit: currency-USD
          
      
    
    
  

Also saw elsewhere

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            description: Max income for an automatic 0 EFC
          
          
            
            description: The Education Department sets the Expected Family Contribution to zero if a family has income below this value.
          
      
    
    
  

Please phrase parameter descriptions like this.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  2023-01-01: .22
          
          
            
                  2023-01-01: 0.22
          
      
    
    
  

And elsewhere

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                label = "Dependent Allowances"
          
          
            
                label = "Pell Grant dependent allowances"
          
      
    
    
  

And elsewhere
Do we need assets separately for dependents? Or can we filter using the dependent variable since it's person level?
We can populate this with a formula based on other variables
Think you want a different name here?
Is this specific to the Pell Grant program?
Reorganize into amount/{min,max}.yaml
Are these all only in the EFC formula or is any in USC or CFR?

This isn't on page 10
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  href: https://fsapartners.ed.gov/sites/default/files/2021-08/2223EFCFormulaGuide.pdf#page=10
          
          
            
                  href: https://fsapartners.ed.gov/sites/default/files/2021-08/2223EFCFormulaGuide.pdf#page=5

Similarly elsewhere
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                - title: THE EFC FORMULA, 2022–2023
          
          
            
                - title: THE EFC FORMULA, 2022–2023, line 43

You can simplify this by representing it as a marginal rate type for positive values (the x in $x + y% of AAI over $z follows mechanically from the marginal structure), and then adding special logic for the negative values.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    allowances_from_head = where(
          
          
            
                    allowances_from_head = -min_(head_available_income, 0)

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                label = "Dependent Availble Income"
          
          
            
                label = "Dependent available income"

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    ajusted_income = (income - allowances) * p.income_modification
          
          
            
                    adjusted_income = (income - allowances) * p.income_modification

Or some variable name like this
Also you may need to do something like formula == formula.possible_values.B
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    return where(
          
          
            
                    total = where(formula == "B", available_income, total_head_contribution)
          
          
            
                    return total / dependents

We generally avoid reusing Python variables. You can use the params directly.
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    amount = min_(coa - efc, maximum)
          
          
            
                    unbounded = coa - efc
          
          
            
                    capped = min_(unbounded, p.amount.max)

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                definition_period = YEAR
          
          
            
                definition_period = YEAR
          
          
            
                
          
          
            
                def formula(tax_unit, period, parameters):
          
          
            
                    person = tax_unit.members
          
          
            
                    is_head = person("is_tax_unit_head", period)
          
          
            
                    assets = person("pell_grant_countable_assets", period)
          
          
            
                    return tax_unit.sum(is_head * assets)
Make a list parameter for the qualifying benefits. You should then be able to pass them all to add at once.
Can combine these into school_meal_net_subsidy

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                label = "Pell Grant dependent availble income"
          
          
            
                label = "Pell Grant dependent available income"
Could you further organize this folder? e.g. with a new allowances or dependent folder.

Word other descriptions similarly, usually with this somewhere.
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            description: The Education Department defines the percent of a dependent student's assets that is counted towards the expected family contribution.
          
          
            
            description: The Education Department counts this share of a dependent student's assets towards the expected family contribution.

Can you be more specific though? Do they multiply them?
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            description: The Education Depaurtment uses these values to ajust the income of the head and their spouse based on the formula being used.
          
          
            
            description: The Education Department adjusts the income of the head and their spouse by these factors based on the formula being used.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  href: 'https://www.fcc.gov/acp'
          
          
            
                  href: https://www.fcc.gov/acp

our convention
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    people = tax_unit.members
          
          
            
                    person = tax_unit.members

simplify
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    is_parent = is_head | is_spouse
          
          
            
                    is_parent = ~person("is_tax_unit_dependent", period)

use below
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    zero_efc_max = parameters(period).gov.ed.pell_grant.efc.automatic_zero
          
          
            
                    zero_efc_max = parameters(period).gov.ed.pell_grant.efc.automatic_zero
          
          
            
                    automatic_zero = head_income <= zero_efc_max

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            has_dependents * ~in_head,
          
          
            
                            has_dependents & ~in_head,
Some benefits are different entity types. Does that matter with the list?
No, adds and add sum across entity types
Is this tuition only or total cost?

can skip the extra variable in these cases. also please rename to income_limit
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    income_eligible = head_income < max_income
          
          
            
                    income_eligible = head_income < p.income_limit
this excludes spouse income?

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    ajusted_assets = assets * p.asset_modification[formula] * ~simplified
          
          
            
                    adjusted_assets = assets * p.asset_modification[formula] * ~simplified

other descriptions

  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            description: Maximum value of the Pell Grant
          
          
            
            description: The Department of Education limits Pell Grants to this amount.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            description: Minimum value of the Pell Grant. Anything lower than this amount will result in a Pell Grant amount of zero
          
          
            
            description: The Department of Education does not provide Pell Grants if the calculated amount is less than this value.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            description: The Education Department sets the Expected Family Contribution to zero if a family has income below this value.
          
          
            
            description: The Department of Education sets the Expected Family Contribution to zero if a family has income below this value.

and others (I think I miswrote this initially)
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            description: The Education Department counts this share of a dependent student's assets towards the expected family contribution.
          
          
            
            description: The Department of Education counts this share of a dependent student's assets towards the expected family contribution.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            description: The Education Department does not count this amount of income towards the expected family contribution.
          
          
            
            description: The Department of Education disregards this amount of income when computing the expected family contribution.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              type: marginal_rate
          
          
            
              label: EFC rate
          
          
            
              type: marginal_rate

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              unit: list
          
          
            
                label: Qualifying benefits for EFC simplified formula
          
          
            
                unit: list

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  href: https://fsapartners.ed.gov/knowledge-center/library/dear-colleague-letters/2023-01-26/2023-2024-federal-pell-grant-payment-and-disbursement-schedules
          
          
            
                  # "As a reminder, in using the attached schedules for awarding a Federal Pell Grant
          
          
            
                  #  to a student, the full nine-month EFC must always be used regardless of the
          
          
            
                  #  student’s actual period of attendance."
          
          
            
                  href: https://fsapartners.ed.gov/knowledge-center/library/dear-colleague-letters/2023-01-26/2023-2024-federal-pell-grant-payment-and-disbursement-schedules

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            description: The number of months in the school year is defined as this value.
          
          
            
            description: The Department of Education defines a full school year as this number of months.

Borrowing language from the form
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              label: Percent of dependent assets for the dependent contribution
          
          
            
              label: EFC dependent asset assessment rate
maybe rename to asset_assessment_rate?
similarly income_assessment_rate?

Include the program name in the label
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              label: Percent of dependent income for the dependent contribution
          
          
            
              label: Pell Grant EFC dependent income assessment rate

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            description: The Education Department counts this percent of a dependent student's income towards the expected family contribution.
          
          
            
            description: The Education Department counts this percent of a dependent student's income towards the Pell Grant expected family contribution.
This does not exclude spouse income. Is there a better name for this that would make it more clear?
how does the document describe it?
The document calls it parent income for formula A and student/spouse income for formulas B and C.

how about pell_grant_primary_income?
per chatgpt: https://chat.openai.com/share/6d013c41-719c-483c-9cf5-b684220303d4
